TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableList.name: by_set_of_references
TunableList.description: A set of references that the objects should be in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type_special
TunableTuple.description: The token is a specified string grabbed from a supported participant type that requires special handling. Currently supported are: I. Participants that resolve into households 1. Household Name 2. Household Description 2. Participants that resolve into zone ids 1. Lot Name 2. Lot Description 3. Name of household that lives there 4. Description of household that lives there.

TunableTuple.name: household
TunableTuple.description: Helper class used to support participants that resolve into households.

TunableVariant.name: attribute
TunableVariant.description: Which string we are interested in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant that resolves to a household.

TunableTuple.name: zone
TunableTuple.description: Helper class used to support participants that resolve into zone ids.

TunableVariant.name: attribute
TunableVariant.description: Which string we are interested in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant that resolves to zone id of a multi unit business.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: sickness
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: small_business
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the small business owned by specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who has small business.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

Tunable.name: clamp_value_to_floor
Tunable.description: If True, the value will be clamped to its floor.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

Tunable.name: use_statistic_name
Tunable.description: If True, the value will be the name of the statistic.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: tns_suppression_group
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the TNS will be considered for suppression. Suppression occurs if the number of notifications in this group that fire exceed the tuned TNS suppression limit.

Tunable.name: CHEF_NOT_SKILLED_ENOUGH_THRESHOLD
Tunable.description: This is the value that a chef must reach when preparing a meal for a customer without displaying the 'Chef isn't skilled enough to make receiver X' The number that must reach this value is the skill adder of the chef and recipe difficulty adder.

Tunable.name: CHEF_SITUATION
Tunable.description: The situation that Sims working as a Chef will have.

TunableTuple.name: CHEF_SKILL_TO_DRINK_FINAL_QUALITY_ADDER_DATA
TunableTuple.display: Chef Skill To Drink Final Quality Adder Data
TunableTuple.description: Pairs a skill with a curve to determine the additional value to add to the final quality of a drink made at an owned restaurant.

TunableList.name: final_quality_adder_curve
TunableList.description: Maps the chef's current level of the tuned skill to a value that will be added to the final quality statistic for drink recipes cooked at an owned restaurant.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: skill
Tunable.description: The skill used to determine the adder for the final quality of drinks.

TunableTuple.name: CHEF_SKILL_TO_FOOD_FINAL_QUALITY_ADDER_DATA
TunableTuple.display: Chef Skill To Food Final Quality Adder Data
TunableTuple.description: Pairs a skill with a curve to determine the additional value to add to the final quality of a food made at an owned restaurant.

TunableList.name: final_quality_adder_curve
TunableList.description: Maps the chef's current level of the tuned skill to a value that will be added to the final quality statistic for food recipes cooked at an owned restaurant.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: skill
Tunable.description: The skill used to determine the adder for the final quality of food.

Tunable.name: CONSUMABLE_EMPTY_STATE_VALUE
Tunable.description: The Consumable_Empty state value. This is the state we'll use to determine if food/drink is empty or not.

Tunable.name: CONSUMABLE_FULL_STATE_VALUE
Tunable.description: The Consumable_Full state value. Food in restaurants will be set to this value instead of defaulting to Consumable_Untouched to avoid other Sims from eating your own food.

TunableList.name: COOKING_SPEED_DATA_MAPPING
TunableList.description: A mapping from chef cooking speed to the data associated with that cooking speed.

Tunable.name: cooking_speed_buff
Tunable.description: The cooking speed buff that is applied to the chef.

TunableTuple.name: cooking_speed_data
TunableTuple.description: The data associated with the tuned cooking speed.

Tunable.name: active_cooking_states_delta
Tunable.description: The amount by which to adjust the number of active cooking states the chef must complete before completing the order. For instance, if a -1 is tuned here, the chef will have to complete one less state than normal. Regardless of how the buffs are tuned, the chef will always run at least one state before completing the order.

Tunable.name: cooking_speed_to_final_quality_adder
Tunable.display: Cooking Speed To Final Quality Adder
Tunable.description: This value is added to the Recipe Difficulty To Final Quality Adder and the Ingredient Quality To Final Quality Adder to determine the player-facing recipe quality.

TunableList.name: COURSE_SORTING_SEQUENCE
TunableList.description: This set determines the sorting sequence for courses in both menu customize UI and in game menu UI.

TunableList.name: COURSE_TO_FILTER_TAGS_MAPPING
TunableList.description: Mapping from course to filter tags for food picker UI.

TunableList.name: course_filter_tags
TunableList.description: This list of filter tags for the food picker UI for the course specified.

TunableEnum.name: course_key
TunableEnum.description: The course associated with the list of filters.

Tunable.name: CUSTOMER_QUALITY_STAT
Tunable.description: The Customer Quality stat applied to food/drink the restaurant customer eats/drinks. This is how we apply buffs to the Sim at the time they consume the food/drink. The Customer Quality value is determined by multiplying the Final Quality To Customer Quality Multiplier (found in Final Quality State Data Mapping) by the Food Difficulty To Customer Quality Multiplier (found in the Ingredient Quality State Data Mapping).

Tunable.name: CUSTOMER_VALUE_STAT
Tunable.description: The Customer Value stat applied to food/drink the restaurant customer eats/drinks. This is how we apply buffs to the Sim at the time they consume the food/drink. The Customer Value value is determined by multiplying the Final Quality To Customer Value Multiplier (found in Final Quality State Data Mapping) by the Markup To Customer Value Multiplier (found in the Markup Data Mapping).

TunableTuple.name: CUSTOMERS_ORDER_EXPENSIVE_FOOD_PERK_DATA
TunableTuple.display: Customers Order Expensive Food Perk Data
TunableTuple.description: The perk that makes customers order more expensive food, and the off-lot multiplier for that perk.

Tunable.name: off_lot_multiplier
Tunable.description: When calculating off-lot profits, this is applied if the household has this perk.

Tunable.name: perk
Tunable.description: If the owning household has this perk, customers will pick two dishes to order and then pick the most expensive of the two.

Tunable.name: DAILY_SPECIAL_DISCOUNT
Tunable.description: The percentage of the base price when an item is the daily special. For example, if the base price is $10 and this is tuned to 80%, the discounted price will be $10 x 80% = $8

TunableEnum.name: DEFAULT_INGREDIENT_QUALITY
TunableEnum.description: The default ingredient quality for a restaurant.

TunableEnum.name: DEFAULT_MENU
TunableEnum.description: The default menu setting for a brand new restaurant.

Tunable.name: DEFAULT_PROFIT_PER_MEAL_FOR_OFF_LOT_SIMULATION
Tunable.display: Default Profit Per Meal For Off Lot Simulation
Tunable.description: This is used as the default profit for a meal for off-lot simulation. Once enough actual meals have been sold, this value becomes irrelevant and the MEAL_COUNT_FOR_OFF_LOT_PROFIT_PER_MEAL tunable comes into use.

TunableEnum.name: DINING_SITUATION_TAG
TunableEnum.description: The tag used to find dining situations. This shouldn't need to be re-tuned after being set initially. If you need to re-tune this you should probably talk to a GPE first.

Tunable.description: If True, override any existing preference. If False, leave existing preference as is.

Tunable.name: final_quality_to_customer_value_multiplier

Tunable.description: This value is multiplied by the Markup To Customer Value Multiplier to determine the value of the Customer Value Stat value of the recipe.
